cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi WSW of Marco Island, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico and tracking toward the central Gulf Coast, aiming near the Mississippi-Alabama border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama border (central Gulf Coast, just west of Mobile Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama–Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Okaloosa–Walton County line, FL westward to east of Morgan City, LA, including Alabama coast, Lake Pontchartrain & Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Navarre, FL westward through Alabama and Mississippi coasts to Shell Beach, LA
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (forecast 4–6 inches with local 8 inches possible)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (predicted 2–4 ft for AL coast, could exceed 3 ft in Mobile Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) expected late Tuesday with brief gusts near hurricane strength possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in and east of Mobile Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of heavy rain with isolated 8 inches; risk of flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, very rough seas and dangerous surf affecting approaches and anchorage areas.
